author: USA TODAY
title: Edelman shouted â€˜I caught it!â€™ after catch
text:
Let friends in your social network know what you are reading about Facebook Email Edelman shouted â€˜I caught it!â€™ after catch Mic'd-up Julian Edelman is fantastic. Post to Facebook Edelman shouted â€˜I caught it!â€™ after catch Mic'd-up Julian Edelman is fantastic.  //ftw.usatoday.com/2017/02/julian-edelman-patriots-micd-up-super-bowl-51-catch-i-caught-it-video-reaction/   Join the Nation's Conversation   Edelman shouted â€˜I caught it!â€™ after catch Alysha Tsuji , USA TODAY 10:30 p.m. ET Feb. 7, 2017 
New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady (12) and wide receiver Julian Edelman (11) celebrate their win over Atlanta Falcons during Super Bowl LI at NRG Stadium. The Patriots won 34-28. (Photo: Bob Donnan-USA TODAY Sports) 
Julian Edelman made one of the greatest catches in NFL history in the fourth quarter of Super Bowl 51 to keep the Patriots hopes alive. He even admitted afterwards that "it was probably like 70 percent luck." 
This is how close it was to touching the ground. 
Now, a couple days after the Pats won the Super Bowl, Inside the NFL released the mic'd-up footage of Edelman's heroic catch. 
Just after making the catch, Edelman confidently shouted, "I caught it! I caught it!" UNREAL ðŸ˜³Watch @Patriots ' @Edelman11 mic'd up making the most clutch catch in #SB51 . #InsideTheNFL finale TONIGHT 9p ET/PT. #Patriots pic.twitter.com/pbBEoMAo9l â€” Inside the NFL (@insidetheNFL) February 7, 2017 
But after The Final Play aka the game-winning touchdown in overtime, Edelman got nervous when Tom Brady told him that it had to be reviewed. He yelled at people to get the (expletive) off the field and told his happy teammates, "It's not over!" until Bill Belichick finally informed him that it was good. . @Edelman11 might have been the last to know @Patriots beat the @AtlantaFalcons ðŸ˜‚ â€” Inside the NFL (@insidetheNFL) February 8, 2017 
The range of emotions is fantastic. Edelman is just like you, Patriots fans. Surely many were scared as it was being reviewed, but then quickly turned to pure joy when it became final - the Patriots won Super Bowl 51.
